attributes.action: Encourage Polish Citizens to apply for an US visa from London.
attributes.additional_details: Encouraging Poles to obtain B 1 and 2 visa from an American Embassy of London or Consulates to make adjusted visa refusal rate going down below 3% that an American congress can decide to abolish visas for Poland as the last Country in Schengen Area and Visegrad Group to Strengthen relation with the United States of America and Visa Waiver Program is Visa Free Regime that allows 38 Countries to go to America without a visa for up to 90 days or less by tourism or business with an ESTA for 2 years.
attributes.background: For over 12 years Poland should join the Visa Waiver Program as to get visas abolished and this is an example of how the visa requirement did not get lifted. [Fiscal Year] 2006 26.2% 2007 25.2% 2008 13.8% 2009 13.5% 2010 9.8% 2011 10.2% 2012 9.3% 2013 10.8% 2014 6.4% 2015 6.37% 2016 5.37% 2017 5.92%

rejection.details:
The UK Government and Parliament are not responsible for the approval of US visas.

You may wish to raise this issue with the Polish Consulate in the UK who may wish to advise their citizens about the issue you raise. You can find out how to contact them here: 

https://london.mfa.gov.pl/en/
